intro: Stenophyllus argentinus, commonly known as the Argentine stenophyll, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and shrublands, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, adapting to arid conditions, while its flowers are small and clustered. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as habitat for small invertebrates.
